【考法 1】 n. 冲动： an impulsive change of mind
【例】 caprice lead him to take the day off from work and go to the beach 一时冲动让他决定休假一天，去海滩度假
【近】 crank, fancy, vagary, vagrancy, whimsy
【考法 2】 n. 善变： an inclination to change one's mind impulsively.
【例】 his knack for picking racetrack赛马场 winners appears to owe归功于 as to caprice
【近】 freakishness, impulsiveness, whimsicalness
【反】 confirmation 确认
【派】 capricious adj. 反复无常的，善变
【反】 steadfast, resolute, constant, pertinacious 坚定不变的
【记】 音：开盘 + price (股市)开价，开盘价是多变的；cap + rice 脑袋里装的都是大米?要不怎么想法反复无常,突变呢
